actors.name: sub-title
actors.text: You have completed part of this lesson

actors.name: text_2_1
actors.text: Acts differently when others are around

actors.name: text_2_2
actors.text: Teases as a joke, but does it a lot

actors.name: text_2_3
actors.text: Ignores you or leaves you out

actors.name: is_it_question
actors.text:
Adam is rushing to class and he runs right into Jen, causing her books to go all over the place. He yells "sorry" over his shoulder, but doesn't stop to help Jen.

Is this bullying?

args.name: yes_answer_text_1
args.text: Not quite. Although Adam should have stopped to help Jen, it sounds like this was an accident. Remember that bullying is intentional and usually repeated over time.

args.name: no_answer_text_1
args.text: Great job! It sounds like this was an accident. Adam didn't run into Jen on purpose. And remember that bullying is intentional and usually repeated over time.

actors.name: is_it_question
actors.text:
Ava takes Tonya's snack from her backpack. Tonya says, "Hey, give that back. I didn't say it was ok yesterday and it's not ok today." Ava responds, "How come it was ok last year, but not this year?"

Is this bullying?

args.name: yes_answer_text_2
args.text: Super! Even if Tonya allowed Ava to take her snacks last year, she clearly has said no twice this year. This is bullying because Ava is not respecting Tonya and is taking her personal property. Ava's intent is to hurt Tonya.

args.name: no_answer_text_2
args.text: Try again. Even though Tonya didn't say anything last year, she's making it clear that it's not ok anymore. This is a repeated act with an intent to hurt Tonya.

actors.name: text_6_2_a
actors.text: Spreading rumors (at school or on the internet)

actors.name: sub-title
actors.text: Bully uses technology to bully others

actors.name: involved_2_text_1
actors.text: Let's see if you can identify who is involved in this bullying situation?

args.name: involved_2_text_isntr
args.text: Drag and drop each label on the character it best describes.
